item.title: Step One: Honesty
item.description: This video describes step one in the Addiction Recovery Program: Admit that you, of yourself, are powerless to overcome your addictions and that your life has become unmanageable.

item.title: Step Two: Hope
item.description: This video describes step two in the Addiction Recovery Program: Come to believe that the power of God can restore you to complete spiritual health.

item.title: Step Three: Trust in God
item.description: This video describes step three in the Addiction Recovery Program: Decide to turn your will and life over to the care of God the Eternal Father and His Son, Jesus Christ.

item.title: Step Four: Truth
item.description: This video describes step four in the Addiction Recovery Program: Make a searching and fearless written moral inventory of yourself.

item.title: Step Five: Confession
item.description: This video describes step five in the Addiction Recovery Program: Admit to yourself, to your Heavenly Father in the name of Jesus Christ, to proper priesthood authority, and to another person the exact nature of your wrongs.

item.title: Step Six: Change of Heart
item.description: This video describes step six in the Addiction Recovery Program: Become entirely ready to have God remove all your character weaknesses.

item.title: Step Seven: Humility
item.description: This video describes step seven in the Addiction Recovery Program: Humbly ask Heavenly Father to remove your shortcomings.

item.title: Step Eight: Seeking Forgiveness
item.description: This video describes step eight in the Addiction Recovery Program: Make a list of all persons you have harmed and become wiling to make restitution to them.

item.title: Step Nine: Restitution and Reconciliation
item.description: This video describes step nine in the Addiction Recovery Program: Wherever possible, make direct restitution to all persons you have harmed.

item.title: Step Ten: Daily Accountability
item.description: This video describes step ten in the Addiction Recovery Program: Continue to take personal inventory, and when you are wrong promptly admit it.

item.title: Step Eleven: Personal Revelation
item.description: This video describes step eleven in the Addiction Recovery Program: Seek through prayer and meditation to know the Lords will and to have the power to carry it out.

item.title: Step Twelve: Service
item.description: This video describes step twelve in the Addiction Recovery Program: Having had a spiritual awakening as a result of the Atonement of Jesus Christ, share this message with others and practice these principles in all you do.

item.title: Twelve Steps to Recovery
item.description: Coordinators and participants in the LDS 12-step addiction recovery program share their stories and their testimonies of the program. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Meet Kerri
item.description: Kerri is devastated by her husbands addiction to pornography, but finds hope and healing through the Atonement of Jesus Christ. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Meet Troy
item.description: Troy faces the reality of his addiction to pornography. Through honesty, repentance, and the healing power of the Atonement of Jesus Christ, he finds peace. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Meet Hetzel
item.description: When Hetzel discovered that her husband was selling drugs and falling deeper into a drug addiction, she felt betrayed and hopeless. She found strength and hope through the Atonement.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Sherrie
item.description: Sherrie alone and isolated, like there must be something fundamentally wrong with her. Through the miracle of the atonement of Jesus Christ, she finally found the ability to overcome her addiction to sex and pornography.

item.title: Meet Ismael
item.description: Ismael knew he needed a change, but thought he could fight his drug addiction alone. When he attended the recovery program, he had success because he learned to apply the principles of repentance.

item.title: Meet McKay
item.description: McKays drug addiction landed him in jail. In his cell, he read the Book of Mormon and felt the power of Jesus Christ that had been missing in his life.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Lou Ann
item.description: Lou Ann was addicted to heroin and meth for 37 years. While in jail, she received an answer to prayer that gave her hope. The Addiction Recovery Program and the Atonement of Christ changed her life.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Karen
item.description: Karen was a nurse, student, and mother who became addicted to pain medications. The Addiction Recovery Program helped her regain control of her life and develop a new relationship with Jesus Christ.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Michael
item.description: Michael was an alcoholic and a meth addict. When his life spiraled out of control he realized he needed spiritual help. The atonement of Jesus Christ helped him turn his life completely around.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Sidreis
item.description: Sidreis is recovering from a sexual addiction. The atonement helped heal the deep personal wounds she felt.

item.title: Addiction Recovery - Meet Rod
item.description: Rod was an alcoholic and cocaine addict. From a young age, he would lie and steal for his addiction. In his darkest moment, he decided to change his life and welcome the power of the Savior’s Atonement.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Mark
item.description: Mark could feel God reaching out for him, even though he was an addict, an alcoholic and hadnt tried to follow Gods commandments.

item.title: Watch Your Step
item.description: See how a moment’s decision can have far-reaching consequences—for good or bad.

item.title: Loving and Serving Others
item.description: Not long after Elder and Sister Olsen were married, they had a desire to serve a mission. They chose to serve in the Addiction Recovery Program, where they learned to serve with unconditional love.

item.title: A Time and a Season
item.description: Church-service missionaries serve in the addiction recovery program. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Why should parents talk to their children about sexual intimacy?
item.description: Children and youth receive so many toxic and distorted messages about sexual intimacy. The home is the ideal place to teach them. Its up to parents to teach them plainly and boldly.

item.title: What if talking about sexual intimacy makes me uncomfortable?
item.description: Its worth the discomfort to talk to children about sexual intimacy. If we dont, someone else will.

item.title: How often do I have to talk to my children about healthy sexual intimacy?
item.description: Lessons about sexual intimacy should be layered from little children until dating and marriage. It shouldnt be a onetime event.

item.title: How do we relate to our children?
item.description: If children know that youre comfortable talking about things and you understand them, theyll have an easier time talking to you.

item.title: What’s the biggest difference between what the world teaches and what the gospel teaches about sexuality?
item.description: The world emphasizes sex as just a physical experience. The gospel teaches, if in within the proper bounds of marriage, its a unifying of the body and the spirit.

item.title: Should parents just talk about the physical aspect of healthy sexuality?
item.description: Parents need to focus on the emotional and relational side of sexuality in preparation for a strong marriage. Chastity does not end in marriage. Teach children why sex means so much more in a healthy marriage relationship.

item.title: Why should you start teaching about intimacy early?
item.description: Starting as a toddler is a great way to prevent sexual abuse. A great way to start with young children is to talk about the differences between boys and girls.

item.title: How do you know when it’s a good teaching moment?
item.description: We need to do as much as possible to be available to our children. The best moments for teaching aren’t always the most convenient.

item.title: What should I share with my children?
item.description: Share your own experiences and let your children see a healthy relationship.

item.title: Is there help for me to teach my children?
item.description: Youre not alone. There are a lot of great resources to help you teach. When you are teaching truth, the Spirit does help you.

item.title: What if I feel overwhelmed about teaching my children about intimacy?
item.description: Making this a priority will help you with a lot of other aspects of teaching. It will improve your relationship so that theyll come to you for questions with hard things.

item.title: How do Heavenly Father and the Spirit help you teach?
item.description: The Spirit will help you recognize each childs needs.

item.title: Should I be open about what I teach my children?
item.description: Children appreciate you being honest and open about intimacy.

item.title: What if I get discouraged?
item.description: Call upon Heavenly Father to help those messages stick with your children when youre not with them. Focus on progression, not perfection.

item.title: How do I focus on the positive aspects of healthy sexuality?
item.description: Sometimes we focus on the negative aspects of sexuality. Need to prepare children for healthy sexuality.

item.title: How do I focus on a gospel view of sexuality?
item.description: The world views sex as selfish and narcissistic. Sexual relations should be enjoyed in a healthy marriage relationship. People dont just need to enter marriage pure; they need to enter prepared.

item.title: How do you prepare youth for healthy sexual relations in marriage?
item.description: The scriptures often refer to sexual relations as they knew someone. Social skills need to be developed in sex education to really get to know someone.

item.title: What’s the best thing parents can do to protect children from negative sexual influences?
item.description: Start teaching children young about healthy sexuality in a layered fashion. Teach it plainly and boldly. It needs to be done. Children are getting too few gospel messages and too many negative worldly messages.

item.title: How do you break the ice when talking with children about intimacy?
item.description: Tie these conversations about intimacy into life events. Always be looking for appropriate opportunities to bring it up.

item.title: What are some things not to do when teaching children about sex?
item.description: We dont want children to feel like theyre bringing up something we dont discuss or we dont talk about. Be encouraging and invite. Let them know that mistakes are a part of life, but teach them about the Atonement.

category.title: Introduction to the ARP and Spouse and Family Programs
category.subtitle: Videos: 4

item.title: What to Expect at a 12 Step Recovery Meeting
item.description: This video will help you understand what to expect when you attend a 12-step meeting for the first time.

item.title: What is the 12 Step Program?
item.description: A brief introduction to the 12-step addiction recovery program.

item.title: What to Expect at a Spouse and Family Support Meeting
item.description: This video will help you understand what to expect when you attend a spouse and family support meeting for the first time.

item.title: What is the Spouse and Family Support Program?
item.description: A brief introduction to the spouse and family support meeting.

item.title: What I Know Now: Spouses
item.description: Spouses write a letter to their younger selves concerning what they wish they had known about their loved ones addiction.

item.title: What I Know Now: Parents
item.description: Parents write a letter to their younger selves concerning what they wish they had known about their childs addiction.

item.title: Step 1: Honesty - David’s Story about Sex Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 1 - Honesty: Admit that you, of yourself, are powerless to overcome your addictions and that your life has become unmanageable. Watch Davids story about sex addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 2: Hope - Preston’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 2 - Hope: Come to believe that the power of God can restore you to complete spiritual health. Watch Prestons story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 3: Trust in God - Sharon’s Story about Crystal Meth Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 3 - Trust in God: Decide to turn your will and your life over to the care of God the Eternal Father and His Son, Jesus Christ. Watch Sharons story about crystal meth addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 4: Truth - Austin’s Story about Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 4 - Truth: Make a searching and fearless written moral inventory of yourself. Watch Austins story about addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 5: Confession - Jessica’s Story about Food Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 5 - Confession: Admit to yourself, to your Heavenly Father in the name of Jesus Christ, to proper priesthood authority, and to another person the exact nature of your wrongs.

item.title: Step 6: Change of Heart - Aram’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 6 - Change of Heart: Become entirely ready to have God remove all your character weaknesses. Watch Arams story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 7: Humility - Holly’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 7 - Humility: Humbly ask Heavenly Father to remove your shortcomings. Watch Hollys story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 8: Forgiveness - Larry’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 8 - Seeking Forgiveness: Make a written list of all persons you have harmed and become willing to make restitution to them. Watch Larrys story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 9: Restitution and Reconciliation - John’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 9 - Wherever possible, make direct restitution to all persons you have harmed. Watch Johns story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 10: Daily Accountability - Adrienne’s Story about Cocaine Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 10 - Daily Accountability: Continue to take personal inventory, and when you are wrong promptly admit it. Watch Adriennes story about cocaine addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 11: Personal Revelation - Lindsay’s Story about Heroin Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 11 - Personal Revelation: Seek through prayer and meditation to know the Lord’s will and to have the power to carry it out. Lindsays story about heroin addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 12: Service - Erik’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 12 - Service: Having had a spiritual awakening as a result of the Atonement of Jesus Christ, share this message with others and practice these principles in all you do. Watch Eriks story.

item.title: 12 Steps to Change - Series Trailer
item.description: Introducing 12 Steps to Change, an original Mormon Channel video series highlighting the real struggles and triumphs of people who have overcome addiction.

item.title: She Has a Choice Now
item.description: Bishops serve and care for those who are in their ward boundaries, including those who are not members of the Church.

item.title: Happy to Serve
item.description: Church-service missionaries serve in the bishops storehouse.

item.title: Jerry Foote Family
item.description: Members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints contribute fast offerings to provide for the welfare of people of all faiths in their times of need.

item.title: Los Angeles Volunteers
item.description: A bishop tells about his responsibility to oversee the needs of the ward, giving assistance to families in need. Those families in turn volunteer at welfare facilities, including the storehouse, vineyard, and cannery.

item.title: DI Donations
item.description: At DI, donations assist people in need throughout the world and help fund training for those who struggle to find jobs.

item.title: Community Partnership Programs
item.description: Deseret Industries partners with non-profit agencies such as schools and shelters to help many people receive donations.

item.title: Kristel Ramirez
item.description: Through Deseret Industries, Kristel was able to learn English, receive her GED, and become a certified nursing assistant.

item.title: Earl Smith
item.description: Earl fell on hard times when he ran out of work as a general contractor. DI helped him begin a career in the medical field.

item.title: Johnnys Story
item.description: Deseret Industries, a branch of the Church welfare program, provides training and placement to those who struggle to find jobs or acquire employable skills.

item.title: A New Light About Him
item.description: Deseret Industries, a branch of the Church welfare program, provides mentoring and coaching to those who struggle to find meaningful employment.

item.title: Valenzuela Family
item.description: When Carlos and his family came to the United States from Peru, DI helped him pay for a training program to start a career.

item.title: DI Helps People Discover Opportunities
item.description: DI helps people find where their strengths and weaknesses are and helps guide them in directions they may not have considered before.

item.title: DI Helps People Gain Happiness
item.description: DI helps people who have lost their jobs by giving them opportunities to succeed.

item.title: DI Helps People Develop Spiritually
item.description: DI helps people with their spiritual development.

item.title: DI Helps People Realize Their True Passion
item.description: DI helps their associates go after their true passions.

item.title: DI Helps People Develop Interpersonal Skills
item.description: DI helps an immigrant from Russia overcome her inhibitions.

item.title: DI Helps People Progress In Their Education
item.description: DI helps a young man to improve his knowledge and skills to pass his GED.

item.title: DI Helps People Overcome Personal Trials
item.description: DI helps a woman recognize her abilities and overcome anxieties.

item.title: DI Helps People Progress In Their Work Life
item.description: DI helps people overcome personal challenges and find the job they are looking for.

item.title: DI Helps People Become Qualified for Jobs in America
item.description: DI helps people get jobs in America through their partnerships.

item.title: DI Helps People Develop Values and Discover Who They Truly Are
item.description: DI helps people recognize who they really are and what they stand for.

item.title: DI Helps People Reach Their Goals
item.description: DI helped a single mom reach her goal to become a personal trainer.

item.title: DI Helps People Overcome Personal Barriers and Fears
item.description: DI helps a young man overcome shyness and insecurities.

item.title: DI Helps People Find Jobs Through Business Partnerships
item.description: DI helps a young woman find a job she is passionate about through a business partnership.

item.title: DI Helps People Find Their Desired Career
item.description: DI helps associates by providing guidance and support to help them find a profession.

item.title: DI Helps People Realize and Achieve Their Potential
item.description: DI helped a man put his past behind him and get his life back together.

item.title: DI Helps People with Rehabilitation Through a People-Centered Environment
item.description: DI does more than offer customers a thrift store; it helps individuals overcome personal challenges.

item.title: DI Helps Pre-Missionaries and Returned Missionaries
item.description: DI helps people who are preparing to go on a mission and those who just returned from one.

item.title: DI Supports People and Helps Them Move Forward
item.description: DI helps people realize that change is possible.

item.title: Fast Offerings - The Jerry Foote Family
item.description: A short clip from the Jerry Foote Family video showing the benefits of the fast offering and how it can help those who are in need.

item.title: Jerry Foote Family
item.description: Members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints contribute fast offerings to provide for the welfare of people of all faiths in their times of need.

item.title: Family Home Storage – Meet Jean
item.description: Jean shares her story about how she discovered the blessings of food storage. When her husband lost his job, their preparation helped them live off of what they had saved and stored.

item.title: Family Home Storage – Meet Maureen
item.description: Maureen discusses how she uses her food storage regularly in the family diet and the peace that comes from following the Prophets inspired counsel to be prepared.

category.title: From Crop to Shelf : Behind the Scenes of Welfare
category.subtitle: Videos: 8

item.title: Deseret Transportation
item.description: Deseret Transportation delivers goods to those in need.

item.title: Deseret Dairy
item.description: A team manager at the Elberta dairy explains the process of producing dairy products. He emphasizes the blessing the products are to families in need and expresses the testimony he has gained by helping others.

item.title: Idaho Falls Welfare Community Gardens
item.description: A community garden in Idaho sponsored by Church members provides food for those in need. The welfare farm opened up remnants of the field to members of other faiths to be used as private gardens.

item.title: Deseret Bakery
item.description: Bakery volunteers tell how they are blessed to help those in need. After the bread is ready, that evening trucks take the bread throughout the western United States—not to sell, but to give to those in need.

item.title: Houston Corporate Partnerships
item.description: Through a partnership between the Church, the Houston Food Bank, and various corporations, the Church helps supply food to the poor of Houston.

item.title: Helping Houstons Hungry
item.description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, the Houston Food Bank, and corporate volunteers have partnered to bring about the Peanut Butter Project. To date, over 700,000 jars of peanut butter have been donated to the Houston Food Bank.

item.title: The Labor of His Hands
item.description: Church members around the world volunteer both time and money to serve others-- members and nonmembers alike--as Christ would serve.

item.title: Thanks Be to God
item.description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints produces hundreds of millions of pounds of food on Church-owned welfare farms. This food is harvested, processed, and distributed through volunteer labor and then given to the poor and needy.

item.title: Able to Serve
item.description: Elder Olson talks about his experiences serving as a young Church-service missionary.

item.title: They Gave Up Their Christmas
item.description: Just as the wise men of old gave the Christ child gifts, members of a congregation in California offer service in a vineyard on Christmas day.

item.title: Pepe’s Garden
item.description: Pepe had a large empty field that she could no longer care for. The ward came in and turned the field into a community garden where neighbors— members and nonmembers alike—work together to plant, tend, and harvest crops.

item.title: Idaho Falls Welfare Community Gardens
item.description: A community garden in Idaho sponsored by Church members provides food for those in need. The welfare farm opened up remnants of the field to members of other faiths to be used as private gardens.

item.title: Los Angeles Volunteers
item.description: A bishop tells about his responsibility to oversee the needs of the ward, giving assistance to families in need. Those families in turn volunteer at welfare facilities, including the storehouse, vineyard, and cannery.

item.title: Madera Vineyard Relief Society
item.description: Sisters volunteering at the Madera vineyard explain Relief Societys mission to serve.

item.title: Houston Corporate Partnerships
item.description: Through a partnership between the Church, the Houston Food Bank, and various corporations, the Church helps supply food to the poor of Houston.

item.title: A Time and a Season
item.description: Church-service missionaries serve in the addiction recovery program. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Happy to Serve
item.description: Church-service missionaries serve in the bishops storehouse.

item.title: Madera Volunteers
item.description: Each year, volunteers from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints harvest over 300,000 pounds of raisins from the Madera vineyard. These raisins are donated to the poor and needy all over the world.

item.title: The Labor of His Hands
item.description: Church members around the world volunteer both time and money to serve others-- members and nonmembers alike--as Christ would serve.

item.title: Michelles Story
item.description: Local Church leaders and members strive to help the poor and needy and follow the admonition of James to visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction (James 1:27).

item.title: Helping Houstons Hungry
item.description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, the Houston Food Bank, and corporate volunteers have partnered to bring about the Peanut Butter Project. To date, over 700,000 jars of peanut butter have been donated to the Houston Food Bank.

item.title: Melissa’s Ramp
item.description: Members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints seek opportunities to serve their fellowmen in their wards, communities, and beyond.

item.title: The Miracle of The Roof
item.description: A group of 11 men from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints assist a man by restoring his roof.
